Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.
description.843: Sell life, property, casualty, health, automotive, or other types of insurance. May refer clients to independent brokers, work as an independent broker, or be employed by an insurance company.
description.844: Review individual applications for insurance to evaluate degree of risk involved and determine acceptance of applications.
description.845: Gather, analyze, or evaluate information from a variety of sources, such as law enforcement databases, surveillance, intelligence networks or geographic information systems. Use intelligence data to anticipate and prevent organized crime activities, such as terrorism.
description.846: Plan, design, and furnish the internal space of rooms or buildings. Design interior environments or create physical layouts that are practical, aesthetic, and conducive to the intended purposes. May specialize in a particular field, style, or phase of interior design.
description.847: Interpret oral or sign language, or translate written text from one language into another.
description.848: Interview persons by telephone, mail, in person, or by other means for the purpose of completing forms, applications, or questionnaires. Ask specific questions, record answers, and assist persons with completing form. May sort, classify, and file forms.
description.849: Plan, direct, or coordinate investment strategy or operations for a large pool of liquid assets supplied by institutional investors or individual investors.
description.850: Keep buildings in clean and orderly condition. Perform heavy cleaning duties, such as cleaning floors, shampooing rugs, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish. Duties may include tending furnace and boiler, performing routine maintenance activities, notifying management of need for repairs, and cleaning snow or debris from sidewalk.
description.851: Design, fabricate, adjust, repair, or appraise jewelry, gold, silver, other precious metals, or gems.
description.852: Arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, or administer justice in a court of law. May sentence defendant in criminal cases according to government statutes or sentencing guidelines. May determine liability of defendant in civil cases. May perform wedding ceremonies.
description.853: Assist judges in court or by conducting research or preparing legal documents.
description.854: Teach academic and social skills to kindergarten students.
description.855: Resolve disputes between workers and managers, negotiate collective bargaining agreements, or coordinate grievance procedures to handle employee complaints.
description.856: Manually move freight, stock, luggage, or other materials, or perform other general labor. Includes all manual laborers not elsewhere classified.
description.857: Plan and design land areas for projects such as parks and other recreational facilities, airports, highways, hospitals, schools, land subdivisions, and commercial, industrial, and residential sites.
description.858: Landscape or maintain grounds of property using hand or power tools or equipment. Workers typically perform a variety of tasks, which may include any combination of the following: sod laying, mowing, trimming, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, sprinkler installation, and installation of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units.
description.859: Set up, operate, or tend lathe and turning machines to turn, bore, thread, form, or face metal or plastic materials, such as wire, rod, or bar stock.
description.860: Operate or tend washing or dry-cleaning machines to wash or dry-clean industrial or household articles, such as cloth garments, suede, leather, furs, blankets, draperies, linens, rugs, and carpets. Includes spotters and dyers of these articles.
description.861: Teach courses in law. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.862: Represent clients in criminal and civil litigation and other legal proceedings, draw up legal documents, or manage or advise clients on legal transactions. May specialize in a single area or may practice broadly in many areas of law.
description.863: Lay out reference points and dimensions on metal or plastic stock or workpieces, such as sheets, plates, tubes, structural shapes, castings, or machine parts, for further processing. Includes shipfitters.
description.864: Perform secretarial duties using legal terminology, procedures, and documents. Prepare legal papers and correspondence, such as summonses, complaints, motions, and subpoenas. May also assist with legal research.
description.865: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library's media equipment.
description.866: Compile records, and sort, shelve, issue, and receive library materials such as books, electronic media, pictures, cards, slides and microfilm. Locate library materials for loan and replace material in shelving area, stacks, or files according to identification number and title. Register patrons to permit them to borrow books, periodicals, and other library materials.
description.867: Teach courses in library science. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.868: Assist librarians by helping readers in the use of library catalogs, databases, and indexes to locate books and other materials; and by answering questions that require only brief consultation of standard reference. Compile records; sort and shelve books or other media; remove or repair damaged books or other media; register patrons; and check materials in and out of the circulation process. Replace materials in shelving area (stacks) or files. Includes bookmobile drivers who assist with providing services in mobile libraries.
description.869: Care for ill, injured, or convalescing patients or persons with disabilities in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, group homes, and similar institutions. May work under the supervision of a registered nurse. Licensing required.
description.870: Monitor recreational areas, such as pools, beaches, or ski slopes, to provide assistance and protection to participants.
description.871: Drive a light vehicle, such as a truck or van, with a capacity of less than 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW), primarily to pick up merchandise or packages from a distribution center and deliver. May load and unload vehicle.
description.872: Operate underground loading or moving machine to load or move coal, ore, or rock using shuttle or mine car or conveyors. Equipment may include power shovels, hoisting engines equipped with cable-drawn scraper or scoop, or machines equipped with gathering arms and conveyor.
description.873: Interview loan applicants to elicit information; investigate applicants' backgrounds and verify references; prepare loan request papers; and forward findings, reports, and documents to appraisal department. Review loan papers to ensure completeness, and complete transactions between loan establishment, borrowers, and sellers upon approval of loan.
description.874: Evaluate, authorize, or recommend approval of commercial, real estate, or credit loans. Advise borrowers on financial status and payment methods. Includes mortgage loan officers and agents, collection analysts, loan servicing officers, loan underwriters, and payday loan officers.
description.875: Provide personal items to patrons or customers in locker rooms, dressing rooms, or coatrooms.
description.876: Repair and open locks, make keys, change locks and safe combinations, and install and repair safes.
description.877: Drive electric, diesel-electric, steam, or gas-turbine-electric locomotives to transport passengers or freight. Interpret train orders, electronic or manual signals, and railroad rules and regulations.
description.878: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities of an organization or department that provides lodging and other accommodations.
description.879: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.
description.880: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers.
description.881: Analyze and coordinate the ongoing logistical functions of a firm or organization. Responsible for the entire life cycle of a product, including acquisition, distribution, internal allocation, delivery, and final disposal of resources.
description.882: Analyze product delivery or supply chain processes to identify or recommend changes. May manage route activity including invoicing, electronic bills, and shipment tracing.
description.883: Design or analyze operational solutions for projects such as transportation optimization, network modeling, process and methods analysis, cost containment, capacity enhancement, routing and shipment optimization, or information management.
description.884: Plan and direct policies, procedures, or systems to prevent the loss of assets. Determine risk exposure or potential liability, and develop risk control measures.
description.885: Provide therapy to patients with visual impairments to improve their functioning in daily life activities. May train patients in activities such as computer use, communication skills, or home management skills.
description.886: Feed materials into or remove materials from machines or equipment that is automatic or tended by other workers.
description.887: Set up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts and instruments out of metal. Includes precision instrument makers who fabricate, modify, or repair mechanical instruments. May also fabricate and modify parts to make or repair machine tools or maintain industrial machines, applying knowledge of mechanics, mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures.
description.888: Operate Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scanners. Monitor patient safety and comfort, and view images of area being scanned to ensure quality of pictures. May administer gadolinium contrast dosage intravenously. May interview patient, explain MRI procedures, and position patient on examining table. May enter into the computer data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry.
description.889: Perform any combination of light cleaning duties to maintain private households or commercial establishments, such as hotels and hospitals, in a clean and orderly manner. Duties may include making beds, replenishing linens, cleaning rooms and halls, and vacuuming.
description.890: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution. Time-stamp, open, read, sort, and route incoming mail; and address, seal, stamp, fold, stuff, and affix postage to outgoing mail or packages. Duties may also include keeping necessary records and completed forms.
description.891: Lubricate machinery, change parts, or perform other routine machinery maintenance.
description.892: Perform work involving the skills of two or more maintenance or craft occupations to keep machines, mechanical equipment, or the structure of a building in repair. Duties may involve pipe fitting; HVAC maintenance; insulating; welding; machining; carpentry; repairing electrical or mechanical equipment; installing, aligning, and balancing new equipment; and repairing buildings, floors, or stairs.
description.893: Apply makeup to performers to reflect period, setting, and situation of their role.
description.894: Conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Includes program analysts and management consultants.
description.895: Clean and shape customers' fingernails and toenails. May polish or decorate nails.
description.896: Move or install mobile homes or prefabricated buildings.
description.897: Design, integrate, or improve manufacturing systems or related processes. May work with commercial or industrial designers to refine product designs to increase producibility and decrease costs.
description.898: Design, develop, and evaluate the operation of marine vessels, ship machinery, and related equipment, such as power supply and propulsion systems.
description.899: Research conditions in local, regional, national, or online markets. Gather information to determine potential sales of a product or service, or plan a marketing or advertising campaign. May gather information on competitors, prices, sales, and methods of marketing and distribution. May employ search marketing tactics, analyze web metrics, and develop recommendations to increase search engine ranking and visibility to target markets.
description.900: Install or repair heating, central air conditioning, HVAC, or refrigeration systems, including oil burners, hot-air furnaces, and heating stoves.
description.901: Drive a tractor-trailer combination or a truck with a capacity of at least 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW). May be required to unload truck. Requires commercial drivers' license. Includes tow truck drivers.
description.902: Help brickmasons, blockmasons, stonemasons, or tile and marble setters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.903: Help carpenters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.904: Help electricians by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.905: Help extraction craft workers, such as earth drillers, blasters and explosives workers, derrick operators, and mining machine operators, by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying equipment or cleaning work area.
description.906: Help installation, maintenance, and repair workers in maintenance, parts replacement, and repair of vehicles, industrial machinery, and electrical and electronic equipment. Perform duties such as furnishing tools, materials, and supplies to other workers; cleaning work area, machines, and tools; and holding materials or tools for other workers.
description.907: Help painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.908: Help plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.909: Help production workers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.910: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.911: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.
description.912: Research, analyze, record, and interpret the past as recorded in sources, such as government and institutional records, newspapers and other periodicals, photographs, interviews, films, electronic media, and unpublished manuscripts, such as personal diaries and letters.
description.913: Teach courses in human history and historiography. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.914: Apply knowledge of health and disease causes to evaluate new laboratory techniques and procedures to examine tissue samples. Process and prepare histological slides from tissue sections for microscopic examination and diagnosis by pathologists. May solve technical or instrument problems or assist with research studies.
description.915: Operate or tend hoists or winches to lift and pull loads using power-operated cable equipment.
description.916: Repair, adjust, or install all types of electric or gas household appliances, such as refrigerators, washers, dryers, and ovens.
description.917: Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. Work is performed under the direction of offsite or intermittent onsite licensed nursing staff. Provide assistance with routine healthcare tasks or activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, toileting, or ambulation. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient's abilities.
description.918: Provide inpatient care predominantly in settings such as medical wards, acute care units, intensive care units, rehabilitation centers, or emergency rooms. Manage and coordinate patient care throughout treatment.
description.919: Welcome patrons, seat them at tables or in lounge, and help ensure quality of facilities and service.
description.920: Accommodate hotel, motel, and resort patrons by registering and assigning rooms to guests, issuing room keys or cards, transmitting and receiving messages, keeping records of occupied rooms and guests' accounts, making and confirming reservations, and presenting statements to and collecting payments from departing guests.
description.921: Design objects, facilities, and environments to optimize human well-being and overall system performance, applying theory, principles, and data regarding the relationship between humans and respective technology. Investigate and analyze characteristics of human behavior and performance as it relates to the use of technology.
description.922: Compile and keep personnel records. Record data for each employee, such as address, weekly earnings, absences, amount of sales or production, supervisory reports, and date of and reason for termination. May prepare reports for employment records, file employment records, or search employee files and furnish information to authorized persons.
description.923: Plan, direct, or coordinate human resources activities and staff of an organization.
description.924: Recruit, screen, interview, or place individuals within an organization. May perform other activities in multiple human resources areas.
description.925: Monitor and control activities associated with hydropower generation. Operate plant equipment, such as turbines, pumps, valves, gates, fans, electric control boards, and battery banks. Monitor equipment operation and performance and make necessary adjustments to ensure optimal performance. Perform equipment maintenance and repair as necessary.
description.926: Manage operations at hydroelectric power generation facilities. Maintain and monitor hydroelectric plant equipment for efficient and safe plant operations.
description.927: Research the distribution, circulation, and physical properties of underground and surface waters; and study the form and intensity of precipitation and its rate of infiltration into the soil, movement through the earth, and return to the ocean and atmosphere.
description.928: Apply principles and processes of natural ecosystems to develop models for efficient industrial systems. Use knowledge from the physical and social sciences to maximize effective use of natural resources in the production and use of goods and services. Examine societal issues and their relationship with both technical systems and the environment.
description.929: Apply engineering theory and principles to problems of industrial layout or manufacturing production, usually under the direction of engineering staff. May perform time and motion studies on worker operations in a variety of industries for purposes such as establishing standard production rates or improving efficiency.
description.930: Design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for managing industrial production processes, including human work factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, cost analysis, and production coordination.
description.931: Repair, install, adjust, or maintain industrial production and processing machinery or refinery and pipeline distribution systems. May also install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to plans.
description.932: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.
description.933: Operate industrial trucks or tractors equipped to move materials around a warehouse, storage yard, factory, construction site, or similar location.
description.934: Apply principles of psychology to human resources, administration, management, sales, and marketing problems. Activities may include policy planning; employee testing and selection, training, and development; and organizational development and analysis. May work with management to organize the work setting to improve worker productivity.
description.935: Plan, implement, upgrade, or monitor security measures for the protection of computer networks and information. Assess system vulnerabilities for security risks and propose and implement risk mitigation strategies. May ensure appropriate security controls are in place that will safeguard digital files and vital electronic infrastructure. May respond to computer security breaches and viruses.
description.936: Plan, initiate, and manage information technology (IT) projects. Lead and guide the work of technical staff. Serve as liaison between business and technical aspects of projects. Plan project stages and assess business implications for each stage. Monitor progress to assure deadlines, standards, and cost targets are met.
description.937: Inspect, test, sort, sample, or weigh nonagricultural raw materials or processed, machined, fabricated, or assembled parts or products for defects, wear, and deviations from specifications. May use precision measuring instruments and complex test equipment.
description.938: Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. May train and coach teachers. Includes educational consultants and specialists, and instructional material directors.
description.939: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
description.940: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
description.941: Appraise automobile or other vehicle damage to determine repair costs for insurance claim settlement. Prepare insurance forms to indicate repair cost or cost estimates and recommendations. May seek agreement with automotive repair shop on repair costs.
description.942: Process new insurance policies, modifications to existing policies, and claims forms. Obtain information from policyholders to verify the accuracy and completeness of information on claims forms, applications and related documents, and company records. Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.

description.944: Review individual applications for insurance to evaluate degree of risk involved and determine acceptance of applications.
description.945: Gather, analyze, or evaluate information from a variety of sources, such as law enforcement databases, surveillance, intelligence networks or geographic information systems. Use intelligence data to anticipate and prevent organized crime activities, such as terrorism.

description.1007: Help painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.1008: Help plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.1009: Help production workers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.1010: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.1011: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.
description.1012: Research, analyze, record, and interpret the past as recorded in sources, such as government and institutional records, newspapers and other periodicals, photographs, interviews, films, electronic media, and unpublished manuscripts, such as personal diaries and letters.
description.1013: Teach courses in human history and historiography. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.1014: Apply knowledge of health and disease causes to evaluate new laboratory techniques and procedures to examine tissue samples. Process and prepare histological slides from tissue sections for microscopic examination and diagnosis by pathologists. May solve technical or instrument problems or assist with research studies.
description.1015: Operate or tend hoists or winches to lift and pull loads using power-operated cable equipment.
description.1016: Repair, adjust, or install all types of electric or gas household appliances, such as refrigerators, washers, dryers, and ovens.
description.1017: Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. Work is performed under the direction of offsite or intermittent onsite licensed nursing staff. Provide assistance with routine healthcare tasks or activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, toileting, or ambulation. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient's abilities.
description.1018: Provide inpatient care predominantly in settings such as medical wards, acute care units, intensive care units, rehabilitation centers, or emergency rooms. Manage and coordinate patient care throughout treatment.
description.1019: Welcome patrons, seat them at tables or in lounge, and help ensure quality of facilities and service.
description.1020: Accommodate hotel, motel, and resort patrons by registering and assigning rooms to guests, issuing room keys or cards, transmitting and receiving messages, keeping records of occupied rooms and guests' accounts, making and confirming reservations, and presenting statements to and collecting payments from departing guests.
description.1021: Design objects, facilities, and environments to optimize human well-being and overall system performance, applying theory, principles, and data regarding the relationship between humans and respective technology. Investigate and analyze characteristics of human behavior and performance as it relates to the use of technology.
description.1022: Compile and keep personnel records. Record data for each employee, such as address, weekly earnings, absences, amount of sales or production, supervisory reports, and date of and reason for termination. May prepare reports for employment records, file employment records, or search employee files and furnish information to authorized persons.
description.1023: Plan, direct, or coordinate human resources activities and staff of an organization.
description.1024: Recruit, screen, interview, or place individuals within an organization. May perform other activities in multiple human resources areas.
description.1025: Monitor and control activities associated with hydropower generation. Operate plant equipment, such as turbines, pumps, valves, gates, fans, electric control boards, and battery banks. Monitor equipment operation and performance and make necessary adjustments to ensure optimal performance. Perform equipment maintenance and repair as necessary.
description.1026: Manage operations at hydroelectric power generation facilities. Maintain and monitor hydroelectric plant equipment for efficient and safe plant operations.
description.1027: Research the distribution, circulation, and physical properties of underground and surface waters; and study the form and intensity of precipitation and its rate of infiltration into the soil, movement through the earth, and return to the ocean and atmosphere.
description.1028: Apply principles and processes of natural ecosystems to develop models for efficient industrial systems. Use knowledge from the physical and social sciences to maximize effective use of natural resources in the production and use of goods and services. Examine societal issues and their relationship with both technical systems and the environment.
description.1029: Apply engineering theory and principles to problems of industrial layout or manufacturing production, usually under the direction of engineering staff. May perform time and motion studies on worker operations in a variety of industries for purposes such as establishing standard production rates or improving efficiency.
description.1030: Design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for managing industrial production processes, including human work factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, cost analysis, and production coordination.
description.1031: Repair, install, adjust, or maintain industrial production and processing machinery or refinery and pipeline distribution systems. May also install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to plans.
description.1032: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.
description.1033: Operate industrial trucks or tractors equipped to move materials around a warehouse, storage yard, factory, construction site, or similar location.
description.1034: Apply principles of psychology to human resources, administration, management, sales, and marketing problems. Activities may include policy planning; employee testing and selection, training, and development; and organizational development and analysis. May work with management to organize the work setting to improve worker productivity.
description.1035: Plan, implement, upgrade, or monitor security measures for the protection of computer networks and information. Assess system vulnerabilities for security risks and propose and implement risk mitigation strategies. May ensure appropriate security controls are in place that will safeguard digital files and vital electronic infrastructure. May respond to computer security breaches and viruses.
description.1036: Plan, initiate, and manage information technology (IT) projects. Lead and guide the work of technical staff. Serve as liaison between business and technical aspects of projects. Plan project stages and assess business implications for each stage. Monitor progress to assure deadlines, standards, and cost targets are met.
description.1037: Inspect, test, sort, sample, or weigh nonagricultural raw materials or processed, machined, fabricated, or assembled parts or products for defects, wear, and deviations from specifications. May use precision measuring instruments and complex test equipment.
description.1038: Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. May train and coach teachers. Includes educational consultants and specialists, and instructional material directors.
description.1039: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
description.1040: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
description.1041: Appraise automobile or other vehicle damage to determine repair costs for insurance claim settlement. Prepare insurance forms to indicate repair cost or cost estimates and recommendations. May seek agreement with automotive repair shop on repair costs.
description.1042: Process new insurance policies, modifications to existing policies, and claims forms. Obtain information from policyholders to verify the accuracy and completeness of information on claims forms, applications and related documents, and company records. Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.
description.1043: Sell life, property, casualty, health, automotive, or other types of insurance. May refer clients to independent brokers, work as an independent broker, or be employed by an insurance company.
description.1044: Review individual applications for insurance to evaluate degree of risk involved and determine acceptance of applications.
description.1045: Gather, analyze, or evaluate information from a variety of sources, such as law enforcement databases, surveillance, intelligence networks or geographic information systems. Use intelligence data to anticipate and prevent organized crime activities, such as terrorism.
description.1046: Plan, design, and furnish the internal space of rooms or buildings. Design interior environments or create physical layouts that are practical, aesthetic, and conducive to the intended purposes. May specialize in a particular field, style, or phase of interior design.
description.1047: Interpret oral or sign language, or translate written text from one language into another.
description.1048: Interview persons by telephone, mail, in person, or by other means for the purpose of completing forms, applications, or questionnaires. Ask specific questions, record answers, and assist persons with completing form. May sort, classify, and file forms.
description.1049: Plan, direct, or coordinate investment strategy or operations for a large pool of liquid assets supplied by institutional investors or individual investors.
description.1050: Keep buildings in clean and orderly condition. Perform heavy cleaning duties, such as cleaning floors, shampooing rugs, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish. Duties may include tending furnace and boiler, performing routine maintenance activities, notifying management of need for repairs, and cleaning snow or debris from sidewalk.
description.1051: Design, fabricate, adjust, repair, or appraise jewelry, gold, silver, other precious metals, or gems.
description.1052: Arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, or administer justice in a court of law. May sentence defendant in criminal cases according to government statutes or sentencing guidelines. May determine liability of defendant in civil cases. May perform wedding ceremonies.
description.1053: Assist judges in court or by conducting research or preparing legal documents.
description.1054: Teach academic and social skills to kindergarten students.
description.1055: Resolve disputes between workers and managers, negotiate collective bargaining agreements, or coordinate grievance procedures to handle employee complaints.
description.1056: Manually move freight, stock, luggage, or other materials, or perform other general labor. Includes all manual laborers not elsewhere classified.
description.1057: Plan and design land areas for projects such as parks and other recreational facilities, airports, highways, hospitals, schools, land subdivisions, and commercial, industrial, and residential sites.
description.1058: Landscape or maintain grounds of property using hand or power tools or equipment. Workers typically perform a variety of tasks, which may include any combination of the following: sod laying, mowing, trimming, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, sprinkler installation, and installation of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units.
description.1059: Set up, operate, or tend lathe and turning machines to turn, bore, thread, form, or face metal or plastic materials, such as wire, rod, or bar stock.
description.1060: Operate or tend washing or dry-cleaning machines to wash or dry-clean industrial or household articles, such as cloth garments, suede, leather, furs, blankets, draperies, linens, rugs, and carpets. Includes spotters and dyers of these articles.
description.1061: Teach courses in law. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.1062: Represent clients in criminal and civil litigation and other legal proceedings, draw up legal documents, or manage or advise clients on legal transactions. May specialize in a single area or may practice broadly in many areas of law.
description.1063: Lay out reference points and dimensions on metal or plastic stock or workpieces, such as sheets, plates, tubes, structural shapes, castings, or machine parts, for further processing. Includes shipfitters.
description.1064: Perform secretarial duties using legal terminology, procedures, and documents. Prepare legal papers and correspondence, such as summonses, complaints, motions, and subpoenas. May also assist with legal research.
description.1065: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library's media equipment.
description.1066: Compile records, and sort, shelve, issue, and receive library materials such as books, electronic media, pictures, cards, slides and microfilm. Locate library materials for loan and replace material in shelving area, stacks, or files according to identification number and title. Register patrons to permit them to borrow books, periodicals, and other library materials.
description.1067: Teach courses in library science. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.1068: Assist librarians by helping readers in the use of library catalogs, databases, and indexes to locate books and other materials; and by answering questions that require only brief consultation of standard reference. Compile records; sort and shelve books or other media; remove or repair damaged books or other media; register patrons; and check materials in and out of the circulation process. Replace materials in shelving area (stacks) or files. Includes bookmobile drivers who assist with providing services in mobile libraries.
description.1069: Care for ill, injured, or convalescing patients or persons with disabilities in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, group homes, and similar institutions. May work under the supervision of a registered nurse. Licensing required.
description.1070: Monitor recreational areas, such as pools, beaches, or ski slopes, to provide assistance and protection to participants.
description.1071: Drive a light vehicle, such as a truck or van, with a capacity of less than 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW), primarily to pick up merchandise or packages from a distribution center and deliver. May load and unload vehicle.
description.1072: Operate underground loading or moving machine to load or move coal, ore, or rock using shuttle or mine car or conveyors. Equipment may include power shovels, hoisting engines equipped with cable-drawn scraper or scoop, or machines equipped with gathering arms and conveyor.
description.1073: Interview loan applicants to elicit information; investigate applicants' backgrounds and verify references; prepare loan request papers; and forward findings, reports, and documents to appraisal department. Review loan papers to ensure completeness, and complete transactions between loan establishment, borrowers, and sellers upon approval of loan.
description.1074: Evaluate, authorize, or recommend approval of commercial, real estate, or credit loans. Advise borrowers on financial status and payment methods. Includes mortgage loan officers and agents, collection analysts, loan servicing officers, loan underwriters, and payday loan officers.
description.1075: Provide personal items to patrons or customers in locker rooms, dressing rooms, or coatrooms.
description.1076: Repair and open locks, make keys, change locks and safe combinations, and install and repair safes.
description.1077: Drive electric, diesel-electric, steam, or gas-turbine-electric locomotives to transport passengers or freight. Interpret train orders, electronic or manual signals, and railroad rules and regulations.
description.1078: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities of an organization or department that provides lodging and other accommodations.
description.1079: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.
description.1080: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers.
description.1081: Analyze and coordinate the ongoing logistical functions of a firm or organization. Responsible for the entire life cycle of a product, including acquisition, distribution, internal allocation, delivery, and final disposal of resources.
description.1082: Analyze product delivery or supply chain processes to identify or recommend changes. May manage route activity including invoicing, electronic bills, and shipment tracing.
description.1083: Design or analyze operational solutions for projects such as transportation optimization, network modeling, process and methods analysis, cost containment, capacity enhancement, routing and shipment optimization, or information management.
description.1084: Plan and direct policies, procedures, or systems to prevent the loss of assets. Determine risk exposure or potential liability, and develop risk control measures.
description.1085: Provide therapy to patients with visual impairments to improve their functioning in daily life activities. May train patients in activities such as computer use, communication skills, or home management skills.
description.1086: Feed materials into or remove materials from machines or equipment that is automatic or tended by other workers.
description.1087: Set up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts and instruments out of metal. Includes precision instrument makers who fabricate, modify, or repair mechanical instruments. May also fabricate and modify parts to make or repair machine tools or maintain industrial machines, applying knowledge of mechanics, mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures.
description.1088: Operate Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scanners. Monitor patient safety and comfort, and view images of area being scanned to ensure quality of pictures. May administer gadolinium contrast dosage intravenously. May interview patient, explain MRI procedures, and position patient on examining table. May enter into the computer data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry.
description.1089: Perform any combination of light cleaning duties to maintain private households or commercial establishments, such as hotels and hospitals, in a clean and orderly manner. Duties may include making beds, replenishing linens, cleaning rooms and halls, and vacuuming.
description.1090: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution. Time-stamp, open, read, sort, and route incoming mail; and address, seal, stamp, fold, stuff, and affix postage to outgoing mail or packages. Duties may also include keeping necessary records and completed forms.
description.1091: Lubricate machinery, change parts, or perform other routine machinery maintenance.
description.1092: Perform work involving the skills of two or more maintenance or craft occupations to keep machines, mechanical equipment, or the structure of a building in repair. Duties may involve pipe fitting; HVAC maintenance; insulating; welding; machining; carpentry; repairing electrical or mechanical equipment; installing, aligning, and balancing new equipment; and repairing buildings, floors, or stairs.
description.1093: Apply makeup to performers to reflect period, setting, and situation of their role.
description.1094: Conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Includes program analysts and management consultants.
description.1095: Clean and shape customers' fingernails and toenails. May polish or decorate nails.
description.1096: Move or install mobile homes or prefabricated buildings.
description.1097: Design, integrate, or improve manufacturing systems or related processes. May work with commercial or industrial designers to refine product designs to increase producibility and decrease costs.
description.1098: Design, develop, and evaluate the operation of marine vessels, ship machinery, and related equipment, such as power supply and propulsion systems.
description.1099: Research conditions in local, regional, national, or online markets. Gather information to determine potential sales of a product or service, or plan a marketing or advertising campaign. May gather information on competitors, prices, sales, and methods of marketing and distribution. May employ search marketing tactics, analyze web metrics, and develop recommendations to increase search engine ranking and visibility to target markets.

512: Historians conduct thorough research by examining various documents to understand past events.
They analyze historical records to identify patterns of human behavior in response to specific events.
Historians document their findings through meticulous record-keeping of primary sources and secondary materials.
They interpret data from a wide range of sources, including photographs, films, and electronic media.
Including academic literature and books, historians organize and present these resources effectively.
They assess the validity and reliability of historical records to ensure accuracy.
Historians examine personal diaries and letters to gain firsthand insights into individual perspectives on past events.
Using source analysis, they uncover connections between different historical elements that may not be obvious in individual sources alone.
Including newspapers and periodicals, historians gather diverse textual information for comprehensive analyses.
They interpret trends over time by analyzing patterns across multiple data sets.
Historians use critical thinking to identify gaps or inconsistencies in the available evidence.
Including academic articles, newspapers, and books, they organize findings into coherent structures that convey knowledge.
They create detailed timelines and chronologies based on discovered historical facts.
Including maps, graphs, photos, films, and other visual aids, historians visually represent data for better understanding.
They identify patterns within large datasets to discern underlying trends in history.
Historians conduct original research by gathering information from primary sources like personal diaries and interviews.
Using this original work, they contribute new insights into the field of history.
Including secondary analysis based on other researchers' studies, historians expand existing knowledge.
They analyze various sources for consistent findings across different materials to strengthen conclusions.
Including newspapers, films, photographs, maps, graphs, books, diaries, and more, historians compile comprehensive information sets to support their work.
Historians critically evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of each source used in their research.

627: 1. Data Collection: Gathering hydrological data such as water levels, flow rates, and chemical compositions from various sources including sensors, satellites, and field observations.
2. Water Cycle Analysis: Studying the processes of precipitation, evaporation, condensation, and transpiration to understand water distribution globally.
3. Groundwater Study: Investigating groundwater systems to monitor their levels, flow patterns, and recharge rates using geophysical methods and monitoring equipment.
4. contaminant Transport Modeling: Assessing how pollutants move through soil, groundwater, and surface water systems to protect environmental quality.
5. Climate Impact Analysis: Evaluating the effects of climate change on water availability, including melting ice caps and rising temperatures' impacts on precipitation patterns.
6. Environmental Policy Advancement: Collaborating with policymakers to develop strategies that mitigate the impacts of droughts, floods, and pollution on ecosystems and human communities.
7. Water Resource Management Planning: Creating sustainable water management plans for regions experiencing scarcity or overexploitation using hydrological data analysis.
8. River Flow Estimation: Using hydrographs and mathematical models to estimate river flow rates and predict potential flooding impacts.
9. Groundwater recharge Calculation: Determining the rate at which groundwater is recharged by surface water, precipitation, and other sources using geological formations.
10. Streamflow Regulation: Designing infrastructure like dams and reservoirs to regulate streamflow for flood control and efficient water supply.
11. Erosion Monitoring: Assessing soil erosion rates and patterns due to rainfall and human activities to manage land use effectively.
12. Groundwater contaminant Source Identification: Identifying sources of pollution in groundwater systems, such as septic tanks or agricultural runoff.
13. Water Quality Assay: Testing water samples for parameters like pH, dissolved oxygen, and conductivity to ensure compliance with environmental standards.
14. Riverbank Stability Analysis: Evaluating the stability of riverbanks to prevent bank failures that could lead to flooding.
15. Precipitation Pattern Analysis: Analyzing spatial and temporal variations in precipitation patterns using satellite data and ground-based sensors.
16. Groundwater Flow Modeling: Creating models to simulate groundwater flow dynamics influenced by human activities like pumping and recharge.
17. Contaminant Dispersion Simulation: Simulating how contaminants spread through water bodies, including surface runoff and groundwater flow pathways.
18. Ecosystem Health Assessment: Evaluating the health of aquatic ecosystems based on water quality data and hydrological conditions.
19. Climate-Weather Interrelation Study: Examining how climate variability affects weather patterns and their implications for water resources management.
20. Groundwater Level Prediction: Using historical data and models to predict future groundwater levels and their potential impacts on agriculture and communities.
21. Riverbank Erosion Rate Calculation: Calculating the rate at which riverbanks erode due to factors like erosion and sediment transport.
22. Precipitation Infiltration Rate Determination: Measuring how much rainfall infiltrates into the soil after landing on land surfaces.
23. Groundwater Recharge Estimation: Estimating groundwater recharge from various sources such as precipitation, rivers, and percolation from agricultural activities.

24. Water Quality Parameter Measurement: Conducting fieldwork to measure specific water quality parameters like BOD (Biochemical Oxygen Demand), DO (Dissolved Oxygen), and TDS (Total dissolved Solids).
25. Hydrological Modeling Development: Developing new models or improving existing ones for simulating hydrological processes, including precipitation, infiltration, and runoff.

Load and unload materials efficiently from/equa卡车和拖拉机操作工在工作场所周围运输货物，执行诸如仓库、存储区域、工厂、建筑工地等地方的重物运送任务。需要详细列出9个独特的工作任务。让我仔细想一下他们每天要做的具体事情。首先，他们会每天开车运行这些重型卡车或拖拉机，确保安全到达目的地。其次，他们可能需要操作拖车或是牵引车来处理更复杂的运输路线。此外，他们还需要监控设备的运行状态，及时发现并解决问题。接下来，检查轮胎、刹车系统和轴部这些都是日常维护的重要部分，不能忽视。还有就是在与仓库或其他团队合作，确保货物能够按时送达或取回，安排好时间和路线以提高效率。哦，别忘了还要与运输公司沟通，确保运输计划的顺利执行。最后，他们可能需要处理突发事件，比如机械故障或是天气影响，快速解决问题以保障任务顺利完成。这些都符合他们工作的独特性，而且涵盖了从日常维护到团队协作再到紧急情况处理等多个方面。好的，我觉得这样的9个任务既详细又具备代表性，能够很好地展示工业卡车和拖拉机操作工的工作职责范围。

   - Process payments once loan approval is granted, including handling cash or electronic transfers to the borrower.
   - Receive signed loan agreements from borrowers confirming their acceptance of the loan terms.
   - Verify that sufficient funds are available for the approved loan by checking account balances and aba system availability.
   - Prepare and distribute necessary documents to the borrower upon loan establishment, such as ID proofs or payment schedules.
   - Maintain a secure filing system to store all interview notes, references, and loan records in an organized manner.
   - Ensure that all documents are properly labeled and filed with accuracy and completeness.
   - Conduct daily summaries of tasks completed and update any relevant borrower information if changes occur.
   - Review transaction logs for accuracy before preparing end-of-day reports to management.
   - Ensure all financial records comply with internal regulations and external reporting requirements.
   - Provide updates on the status of loan applications to borrowers or interested parties as needed.

Loan Interviewers and Clerkswould primarily perform tasks related to interviewing loan applicants to gather necessary information, verifying their backgrounds, preparing loan documents, forwarding findings, reviewing applications for completeness, and completing transactions once approved. background

This occupation is essential for the financial sector as they evaluate individuals seeking loans and prepare comprehensive reports to support decision-making processes.
   The role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, communication abilities, and proficiency with various software tools used in document preparation and transaction processing.
examples of skills required

- Strong understanding of loan approval processes.

   - Proficiency in using word processors, spreadsheets, and other relevant software applications.
   - Good organizational and time management skills.
   - Excellent communication skills for interacting with applicants and team members.
examples of tasks

The primary examples of tasks include interviewing applicants, verifying references, preparing loan documents, forwarding reports to the appraisal department, reviewing loan applications, completing transactions upon approval, and maintaining accurate records and files.
importance of task performance

Proper completion of these tasks ensures that all loans are approved based on thorough information gathered, reducing errors and improving decision-making.
   Accurate documentation and follow-up on references help in minimizing risks for the lender.

types of software used

Word processors like Microsoft Word or Google Docs are commonly used to create loan request papers and reports.

types of training needed

Basic computer literacy is essential for learning the necessary software applications.

1023: The Human Resources Manager's primary responsibilities involve planning, directing, and coordinating all HR-related activities within their organization.
They are responsible for developing and implementing comprehensive HR policies and procedures that align with the company's strategic goals.
Human Resources Managers also handle employee relations, ensuring a positive work environment and addressing any HR issues efficiently.
They manage the recruitment process, including job postings, resume reviews, interviews, and onboarding procedures to attract and hire top talent.
This role involves overseeing employee training programs to help new hires integrate into their roles effectively and improve overall company performance.
Human Resources Managers also monitor employee performance through various assessments and feedback mechanisms to ensure they meet their responsibilities and goals.
They maintain records such as employee files, attendance reports, and performance evaluations in a organized and efficient manner.
These managers are responsible for creating policies related to employee compensation, benefits, and rewards that enhance employee satisfaction and motivation.
Human Resources Managers regularly conduct performance appraisals to assess employees' contributions and provide feedback for continuous improvement.
They have authority over scheduling interviews and assigning workloads to ensure a fair distribution of tasks among team members.
This role also includes monitoring legal compliance with labor laws, contracts, and regulations to safeguard the company's interests.
Human Resources Managers develop employee wellness programs to improve health and safety among the workforce while reducing workplace injuries.
They organize diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives to foster an inclusive work environment and promote equal opportunities for all employees.
These managers ensure that all HR activities are carried out efficiently within a budgetary constraint to maximize cost-effectiveness.
Human Resources Managers also set up systems for performance improvement programs aimed at enhancing overall company productivity and efficiency.
They facilitate employee development plans, helping individuals grow into their roles while contributing to the organization's success.
This role involves monitoring and analyzing HR metrics to assess the effectiveness of current policies and processes.
Human Resources Managers plan for succession planning by identifying potential leaders and providing training programs to prepare them for future roles.
They ensure compliance with labor laws during all recruitment activities, interviews, and onboarding procedures to prevent legal issues.
These managers review performance data to identify areas where HR initiatives can improve employee engagement and productivity.
Human Resources Managers create policies related to disciplinary actions taken against employees violating company rules or internal discipline.
They handle employee relations through effective communication strategies to resolve disputes and maintain good working conditions.
This role involves collaborating with other departments like finance, IT, and operations to ensure a cohesive organization-wide HR strategy.

description

The occupation involves a comprehensive range of inspection, testing, sorting, sampling, and weighing procedures applied to various materials and products. Inspectors utilize diverse tools and technologies depending on the task's complexity, ensuring adherence to quality standards. They analyze both raw materials and finished goods to guarantee compliance with specifications, enhancing product reliability and safety in different industries.
